title: Calories in Fried Chicken
meta_description: Discover calories in fried chicken per 100 g serving, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and tips for healthier tweaks to fit your diet.
assumptions: Breaded, deep-fried chicken pieces (mixed white/dark meat with skin); standard fast-food style, no sides or sauces.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by breading, oil type, cooking method, portion size, and brand. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of fried chicken contains about 295 kcal, with high protein and fat from frying.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Air-fried instead of deep-fried (less oil absorbed)

faqs.q: How many calories in fried chicken per 100 g?
faqs.a: Approximately 295 kcal for breaded, deep-fried fried chicken.

faqs.q: Is fried chicken high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 19 g total fat per 100 g, mostly from frying oil.

faqs.q: What's the protein in fried chicken?
faqs.a: Around 18 g protein per 100 g, making it a decent source despite the calories.

faqs.q: How does fried chicken compare to grilled?
faqs.a: Fried has ~295 kcal/100 g vs. ~165 kcal for grilled skinless chickenâ€”frying adds carbs and fat.

faqs.q: Why is sodium high in fried chicken?
faqs.a: Breading and seasoning contribute ~650 mg sodium per 100 g; watch for fast-food versions.
